segment.source: Tools to use with AppLocker (Windows 10)
segment.target: Tools to use with AppLocker (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the tools available to create and administer AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the tools available to create and administer AppLocker policies.

segment.source: Tools to use with AppLocker
segment.target: Tools to use with AppLocker

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the tools available to create and administer AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the tools available to create and administer AppLocker policies.

segment.source: The following tools can help you administer the application control policies created by using AppLocker on the local device or by using Group Policy.
segment.target: The following tools can help you administer the application control policies created by using AppLocker on the local device or by using Group Policy.

segment.source: For info about the basic requirements for using AppLocker, see Requirements to use AppLocker.
segment.target: For info about the basic requirements for using AppLocker, see Requirements to use AppLocker.

segment.source: AppLocker Local Security Policy MMC snap-in
segment.target: AppLocker Local Security Policy MMC snap-in

segment.source: The AppLocker rules can be maintained by using the Local Security Policy snap-in (secpol.msc) of the Microsoft Management Console (MMC).
segment.target: The AppLocker rules can be maintained by using the Local Security Policy snap-in (secpol.msc) of the Microsoft Management Console (MMC).

segment.source: For procedures to create, modify, and delete AppLocker rules, see Working with AppLocker rules.
segment.target: For procedures to create, modify, and delete AppLocker rules, see Working with AppLocker rules.

segment.source: Generate Default Rules tool
segment.target: Generate Default Rules tool

segment.source: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection accessed through the Local Security Policy snap-in.
segment.target: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection accessed through the Local Security Policy snap-in.

segment.source: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.
segment.target: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.

segment.source: For info about how to use this tool, see Create AppLocker default rules.
segment.target: For info about how to use this tool, see Create AppLocker default rules.

segment.source: Automatically Generate AppLocker Rules wizard
segment.target: Automatically Generate AppLocker Rules wizard

segment.source: By using the Local Security Policy snap-in, you can automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.
segment.target: By using the Local Security Policy snap-in, you can automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.

segment.source: The wizard will scan the specified folder and create the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.
segment.target: The wizard will scan the specified folder and create the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.

segment.source: For info about how to use this wizard, see Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard.
segment.target: For info about how to use this wizard, see Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard.

segment.source: Group Policy
segment.target: Group Policy

segment.source: You can edit an AppLocker policy by adding, changing, or removing rules by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: You can edit an AppLocker policy by adding, changing, or removing rules by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: If you want additional features to manage AppLocker policies, such as version control, use Group Policy management software that allows you to create versions of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: If you want additional features to manage AppLocker policies, such as version control, use Group Policy management software that allows you to create versions of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: An example of this type of software is the Advanced Group Policy Management feature from the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack.
segment.target: An example of this type of software is the Advanced Group Policy Management feature from the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack.

segment.source: Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT)
segment.target: Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT)

segment.source: You can use a device with a supported operating system that has the Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT) installed to create and maintain AppLocker policies.
segment.target: You can use a device with a supported operating system that has the Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT) installed to create and maintain AppLocker policies.

segment.source: Event Viewer
segment.target: Event Viewer

segment.source: The AppLocker log contains information about applications that are affected by AppLocker rules.
segment.target: The AppLocker log contains information about applications that are affected by AppLocker rules.

segment.source: For info about using Event Viewer to review the AppLocker logs, see Using Event Viewer with AppLocker, and Monitor app usage with AppLocker.
segment.target: For info about using Event Viewer to review the AppLocker logs, see Using Event Viewer with AppLocker, and Monitor app usage with AppLocker.

segment.source: AppLocker PowerShell cmdlets
segment.target: AppLocker PowerShell cmdlets

segment.source: The AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets are designed to streamline the administration of AppLocker policy.
segment.target: The AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets are designed to streamline the administration of AppLocker policy.

segment.source: They can be used to help create, test, maintain, and troubleshoot an AppLocker policy.
segment.target: They can be used to help create, test, maintain, and troubleshoot an AppLocker policy.

segment.source: The cmdlets are intended to be used in conjunction with the AppLocker user interface that is accessed through the Local Security Policy snap-in and the GPMC.
segment.target: The cmdlets are intended to be used in conjunction with the AppLocker user interface that is accessed through the Local Security Policy snap-in and the GPMC.

segment.source: For information about the cmdlets, see the AppLocker PowerShell Command Reference.
segment.target: For information about the cmdlets, see the AppLocker PowerShell Command Reference.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: AppLocker technical reference
